creator: fox@u.washington.edu
text:
The util.c function ap_get_local_host is not written to httpd.exp.
This prevents DSO modules that call ap_get_local_host to fail to load
on AIX, which requires the httpd.exp file.  It appears that the problem
would be solved by declaring ap_get_local_host "AP_DECLARE" instead of "char *"

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
ap_get_local_host() does not appear to be an appropriate routine for modules to
call.  On error paths it writes CRIT error messages, assuming that it is called
by core code at initialization.

(Opinions from other developers?)

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
+1 for removal from the Public API in 2.1

Reviewing the function, it really should be something that gets pushed over to apr for most of it's logic.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text: This function should not be called by external modules.
